intro: Lopezia grandiflora subsp. grandiflora, commonly known as the desert globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as sandy soils and rocky plains. It has palmate leaves with three to five lobes and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Lopezia grandiflora subsp. grandiflora is adapted to drought conditions and is often found in open, disturbed habitats.
